decks.notes: This UW Control deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, board wipes, and card advantage. The deck utilizes a variety of tools such as No More Lies and Three Steps Ahead to disrupt the opponent's game plan, while also generating card advantage with Narset, Parter of Veils and Omen of the Sea. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent with powerful finishers like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and The Wandering Emperor, while also utilizing lands like Field of Ruin and Hall of Storm Giants to control the battlefield.

The primary focus of this deck is to disrupt and control the opponent's game plan through a combination of discard spells, removal spells, and efficient threat management. The synergy between cards like Waste Not, Thoughtseize, and Sheoldred's Edict allows for resource denial and graveyard recursion. Hostile Investigator and Reckoner Bankbuster provide creature-based threats, while Sheoldred, the Apocalypse offers a powerful late-game win condition. The mana base is optimized for consistent black mana sources and utility lands for additional advantage. Overall, the deck aims to out-value and outlast opponents through careful resource management and strategic decision-making.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling a board of artifact creatures and support cards to deal consistent damage to the opponent. It utilizes cards like Ensoul Artifact and Spyglass Siren to power up artifacts and disrupt the opponent's plans. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion offers additional versatility and consistency to the deck. With a mix of aggressive creatures and burn spells like Shrapnel Blast and Torch the Tower, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a strong, fast-paced offense fueled by artifacts.

The Boros Aggro deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a streamlined aggressive strategy, utilizing efficient creatures like Monastery Swiftspear and Soul-Scar Mage alongside powerful instant damage spells such as Play with Fire and Lightning Helix. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Chained to the Rocks to deal with opposing threats. Showdown of the Skalds provides card advantage and pumps up the team, while Jegantha, the Wellspring offers additional value as a companion. The deck's mana base is optimized to support the low curve and aggressive game plan.

The primary focus of this deck is to assemble a combo that involves generating life gain with cards like Prosperous Innkeeper and Wildgrowth Walker, while utilizing creatures like Fauna Shaman to tutor for key combo pieces. Amalia Benavides Aguirre acts as a central piece to the combo, allowing for additional card draw and utility. Return to the Ranks and Chord of Calling provide additional ways to search for combo pieces or reanimate creatures from the graveyard. The deck also includes control elements with Skyclave Apparition and Selfless Savior to protect the combo.

This deck focuses on quickly casting spells to trigger the Arclight Phoenix's ability, bringing it back from the graveyard to deal damage to the opponent. The deck includes a mix of cheap spells, card draw, and control elements to support this strategy, with the goal of overwhelming the opponent with a fast and aggressive playstyle. Additionally, the deck includes some disruptive elements like Ledger Shredder and Ashiok, Dream Render to disrupt the opponent's game plan and gain an advantage.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively build up green devotion through mana ramp creatures and powerful green spells, leading to explosive plays and overwhelming board presence. By efficiently utilizing mana, generating creatures through devotion, and utilizing support cards like Leyline of the Guildpact and Kiora, Behemoth Beckoner, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents quickly and decisively. With a focus on high devotion to green, this aggro deck aims to establish dominance through early aggression and efficient mana utilization.

This deck revolves around creating a powerful life gain combo using cards like Wildgrowth Walker, Amalia Benavides Aguirre, and Aetherflux Reservoir. With the ability to search for key pieces with cards like Collected Company and Chord of Calling, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with a burst of life gain and direct damage. The inclusion of cards like Fauna Shaman and Return to the Ranks provide additional utility and flexibility in finding and retrieving crucial combo pieces.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play Arclight Phoenixes from the graveyard by casting multiple spells in a turn. The deck includes a mix of cheap instant and sorcery spells to trigger the Phoenix's ability, along with card draw and filtering to help find the Phoenixes and maintain card advantage. Additionally, there are some disruptive elements such as Spell Pierce and Ashiok, Dream Render to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes some powerful finishers like Hall of Storm Giants and Treasure Cruise to close out the game quickly.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying artifact creatures and equipping them with powerful enchantments to deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible. By utilizing cards like Ensoul Artifact and Shrapnel Blast, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early in the game. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Spyglass Siren and Smuggler's Copter helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan while also providing card advantage. Overall, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive artifact creatures and efficient removal spells.

This Gruul Aggro deck focuses on fast and aggressive creature plays, supported by a mix of combat tricks and burn spells to maintain pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of Jegantha, the Wellspring as a companion provides additional mana ramp options. The deck also features cards like Monstrous Rage and Rampaging Ferocidon to amplify damage output, while creatures like Questing Druid and Monastery Swiftspear help to keep the aggression up. Overall, the key concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a quick and relentless assault.

This deck focuses on utilizing the cards in the main deck to create powerful combos and discover synergies between the creatures and spells. The key strategy involves generating value through copying creatures like Keruga, the Macrosage with Spark Double and Clever Impersonator, while also utilizing cards like Quintorius Kand and Leyline Binding for additional advantage. The deck also includes powerful creatures like Trumpeting Carnosaur and Beanstalk Giant for board presence and threats. The mana base is carefully constructed to support the diverse color requirements of the deck.

This aggressive Rakdos deck focuses on quickly applying pressure to the opponent through efficient creatures like Bloodtithe Harvester and Vein Ripper while disrupting their game plan with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Duress. The deck also utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Sorin, Imperious Bloodlord to buff its creatures and generate additional value. With a strong mana base and a mix of aggressive threats and disruption, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent before they have a chance to stabilize or mount a defense.

This deck focuses on using aggressive Spirit creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The key strategy involves protecting and buffing your Spirits with cards like Curious Obsession and Supreme Phantom, while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Spell Queller and Geistlight Snare. By combining evasive abilities and tempo plays, the deck aims to close out the game efficiently before the opponent can stabilize. The inclusion of disruption and card advantage spells adds versatility to the deck's game plan, allowing for adaptability in different matchups.

This deck focuses on using artifacts to create a fast and aggressive playstyle, with cards like Smuggler's Copter and Ensoul Artifact to quickly generate threats. The inclusion of cards like Shrapnel Blast and Torch the Tower helps to clear the way for your artifact creatures to attack, while also providing reach to finish off opponents. The deck also utilizes disruptive cards like Spyglass Siren and Spell Pierce to control the game and protect your threats. Jegantha, the Wellspring is used as a companion to provide additional mana and flexibility in casting your spells.

The deck focuses on control through a combination of powerful creatures and removal spells, utilizing Niv-Mizzet Reborn as a key engine to draw cards and generate value. The inclusion of Fable of the Mirror-Breaker helps to find key pieces of the deck, while cards like Lightning Helix and Vanishing Verse provide efficient removal options. The deck also includes a variety of lands to ensure consistent mana fixing, enabling the deck to reliably cast its powerful spells. Additionally, the inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for additional synergy and flexibility in gameplay.

This deck is centered around control through a diverse set of powerful cards, with a focus on utilizing the versatility and card advantage provided by Niv-Mizzet Reborn. The deck also includes various ramp options, removal spells, and ways to disrupt the opponent's game plan. With a strong mana base that supports the deck's multicolor requirements, the goal is to outvalue and outlast the opponent while setting up powerful interactions and win conditions.

The deck focuses on utilizing Niv-Mizzet Reborn as the key player to control the game by casting powerful multicolored spells with Bring to Light to find answers or threats as needed. The deck includes a variety of versatile cards such as Sylvan Caryatid for ramp, Lightning Helix for removal/burn, and Leyline Binding for disruption. The companion, Yorion, Sky Nomad, provides additional value with its ability to blink permanents for card advantage. The mana base is carefully crafted to ensure access to all colors needed for Niv-Mizzet's ability.

This deck focuses on aggressive creature plays and disrupting opponents with hand disruption spells. It puts pressure on the opponent by quickly building up a board presence with creatures like Dusk Legion Zealot, Bloodtithe Harvester, and Archfiend of the Dross. Sorin, Imperious Bloodlord is used to buff up creatures and provide additional value. Additionally, Thoughtseize and Fatal Push are used to control the opponent's resources and keep them on the back foot. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with its aggression and disruption capabilities.
